sentence.Network_en: I watched a slow-motion videotape replay of his fall.
sentence.Network_cn: 我看了一遍录像带上他摔倒时的慢动作重放。

sentence.Network_en: The incident was captured on videotape.
The police think the videotape may hold some vital clues to the identity of the killer.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方认为那盘录像带可能录有能确认凶手身份的一些重要线索。

entry.def: Videotape is magnetic tape that is used to record moving pictures and sounds to be shown on television.
A videotape is the same as a video cassette .
If you videotape a television programme or event, you record it on tape using a video recorder or video camera, so that you can watch it later.

means.word_mean: 1. a video recording made on magnetic tape
2. a relatively wide magnetic tape for use in recording visual images and associated sound
